summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets and inmate rosters from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 9-10, 2019. It includes official out-count forms and a roster showing inmates on suicide watch, providing a snapshot of the facility's population and administrative procedures around the time of Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration.

events.title: Inmate Roster and Suicide Watch List
events.description: An inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center lists several inmates with assignment codes indicating they are on suicide watch or unassigned.

events.title: Official Prison Out-Count
events.description: Bureau of Prisons officials conducted and verified an official out-count of inmates across multiple housing units at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Administrative prison records from August 9-10, 2019, show standard inmate count procedures at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
An inmate roster dated August 9, 2019, lists multiple inmates with assignment codes related to suicide watch ('SUICIDE OR') and unassigned status.
The total inmate population counted across housing units on August 10, 2019, was 758, with 4 inmates out-counted (not in their units during the count).
The documents are procedural forms (count sheets, rosters) that do not name specific inmates, including Jeffrey Epstein, but reflect the facility's operations.
The dates place these records immediately surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019.
